comments.value:
0730 – publish splash page and new section of site, excluding the ‘Carrying the Olympic Flame’ and ‘FAQs’ sections.
1100 – publish the withheld sections and republish a few updated pages (splash and home most likely)

Presumably:
- remove any links to those sections in the body of any published pages, e.g on the OTR home page 
- set the state of the index pages in those sections to "hide from navigation"
- check the navigation now excludes those sections (and republish as necessary)
- switch on publication to the Torch section at some point before 7.30am
- unhide the torch index page from navigation at 7.30am
- republish the games section, so that "Olympic Torch Relay" appears in section navigation
- unhide the index pages in the hidden sections sometime at 11am
- republish the torch section so that the hidden sections turn up in the OTR navigation

ps at times like these static navigation is a bit of a pain.

Updated:
- remove any links to those sections in the body of any published pages, e.g on the OTR home page 
- set the state of the index pages in those sections to "hide from navigation" 
- check the navigation now excludes those sections (and republish as necessary) 
- unhide the torch index page from navigation
- switch on publication to the Torch section at 7.30am 
- republish the games section, so that "Olympic Torch Relay" appears in section navigation 
- switch off publication to the Torch section well before 11am
- unhide the index pages in the hidden sections and republish to staging
- check it all looks ok
- switch publication to the Torch section back on at 11am
- switch on the luckit search index for the Torch section

Hi,

I've been trying for ages to get rid of a couple of bad apostrophes in the Did You Know boxes on the Sport pages. I've tried moving them, rewriting them, rewriting the whole sentence and various other things, but to no avail.

For example, for Handball the sentence in CMS reads The ball must be made of pure leather and have a circumference of about 58 - 60cm in the men's competition. In the women's competition, the circumference is 54 - 56cm.
However, when it reaches the live site it reads The ball must be made of pure leather and have a circumference of about 58 - 60cm in the men's competition. In the women's competition, the circumference is 54 - 56cm.

The same thing is happening on the Modern Pentathlon pages.
Greek philosopher Aristotle described competitors in the Pentathlon of the ancient Games as the most 'perfect sportsmen, because in their bodies strength and speed are combined in beautiful harmony'.

I've managed to get rid of the majority of these cases, but I just can't get rid of these two whatever I do! Do you know what is causing these formatting errors, and how they can be fixed? It's getting pretty frustrating!

Thanks,

Michael

It has happened because somebody has copied the full URL of the pages into the link picker as if they were external links, e.g. http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/jobs/index.php.

Instead, they could have searched for the page to link to in the normal way.

Brilliant, thanks Danny

Hello Tom,

The problem is that people have entered a URL into the link picker, rather
than navigating to - and picking - the required page. I've only checked the
first of them - the Jobs link - which is linked to
http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/jobs/index.php,

This means, additionally, that the "hard-coded" URL appears on the staging
page, too.
http://vip_staging_locog_www.london2012.com/get-involved/

We can possibly generate you a list of all places where URLs have been
"hard-coded" rather than "picked", although this mightn't be a simple task
(i.e. might take up to a day to generate it).

I should note that such links - in general - won't actually *break* anything
(the one exception being if the linked-to page is expired).

Kind regards,

Kieran

If you have the text and are fairly sure it won't change, we can add it in for you, but if it's liable to be tweaked a few times before launch it may be better to take control of it yourselves and edit it in the CMS.

2)  Questions page / template
http://vip_staging_locog_www.london2012.com/get-involved/business-network/travel-advice-for-business/make-your-plan/questions.php

notes:
* we have just taken the text supplied by LIDA 'QA Matrix.xls' let me know if you need any amendments made as we'll need to make them in the code.

3)  The Answers page / template (normally you'll only get to here from the question page above)
http://vip_staging_locog_www.london2012.com/get-involved/business-network/travel-advice-for-business/make-your-plan/results.php?q1=Yes&q2=Yes&q3=Yes&q4=Yes&q5=Yes&q6=Yes&q9=Yes&q11=Yes&q13=Yes&q14=Yes&q22=Yes&q20=Yes

notes:
* the header text can be edited in the CMS (see above or let us have the correct text)
** the popup text for the sign up box will need to be made by us (could you supply the text)
** any changes to the questions will need to be made by us (for now I have left in the number of each answers to aid testing, these will be removed before going live). If possible could we try and bunch up any changes, rather than lots of incremental changes (obviously if we are showing the wrong answers or a issue is immediately obvious, we'll try to fix it right away before it progress to further round of testing).

4) The PDF download link (from the results page, you wouldn't normally access this direct)
http://vip_staging_locog_www.london2012.com/get-involved/business-network/travel-advice-for-business/make-your-plan/download-pdf.php?q1=Yes&q2=Yes&q3=Yes&q4=Yes&q5=Yes&q6=Yes&q9=Yes&q11=Yes&q13=Yes&q14=Yes&q20=Yes&q22=Yes

notes:
* we still need the correct cover for this PDF, preferably A4 (or we can omit it completely which may also speed up the processing of it slightly) for now we have used a dummy cover page.

5) Other things

- Signup link, we are working on some changes here (with the actual / main signup process + registration system) as a separate piece of work due to be completed this week on our development server (although it won't make it to staging server this week due to the current LOCOG/IT code freeze, we will move it across as soon as the freeze is lifted).
- Bookmark link: we only spotted this at the last minute and are unsure how this functionality was to work as many newer browsers don't support this functionality via a "in page link" for security reasons and no client side code was supply to handle this. The user can of course bookmark tier results page via the bookmark tab in their browser and this will bring them back to their personalised answer page.

Hi Uzma,

I've just change the name of the page without changing the file name, which is probably the safest option.

Jamie

* As we havent' changed the file name itself nothing should break, but (for future reference) in terms of dependent pages (ie. ones linking to a given page), if we can, we already track the dependencies and republish any pages that will be affected by a page being renamed or moved automatically. It's the things like drop down menus that often need to be updated manually (in  case the paths are in a static Javascript file for example) and need to be checked manually when a page is renamed (or about to be renamed) it's hard to track these automatically (if we could we'd automate it as part of the normal dependency tracking code) so it's more a case of manually checking the site/section and thinking of  areas are likely to be effected.
